intro: Urticastrum laxiflorum, commonly known as the slenderflower goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, which can cause mild irritation upon contact. Urticastrum laxiflorum is known for its adaptability to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
